english: to cover; ignorant; to receive (favor); Mongolia (abbr.)

etymology.interpretation: Grass radical points to a covering or vegetation sense, while 冡 supplies the méng sound. The phonetic also evokes an idea of covering or a mound, aligning with meanings like “to cover,” which then extends metaphorically to “ignorant” (shrouded) and to proper-noun uses for Mongol-related terms.

examples.chinese: 他蒙着脸走进来(他蒙著臉走進來)。
examples.english: He came in with his face covered.

examples.chinese: 我一直被蒙在鼓里(我一直被蒙在鼓裡)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yīzhí bèi méng zài gǔ lǐ.
examples.english: I’ve been kept in the dark all along.

examples.chinese: 承蒙大家的帮助，我们顺利完成了任务(承蒙大家的幫助，我們順利完成了任務)。
examples.pinyin: Chéngméng dàjiā de bāngzhù, wǒmen shùnlì wánchéng le rènwu.
examples.english: Thanks to everyone’s help, we completed the task smoothly.
